yield_farming.simple_explanation: Yield farming is like putting your money in a high-interest savings account, but for crypto. You lend your PYUSD to earn extra money.
yield_farming.analogy: It's like renting out your spare room - you get paid while your money works for you.
yield_farming.example: Put 100 PYUSD in yield farming, earn 5 PYUSD extra per month.

liquidity.simple_explanation: Liquidity means how easily you can turn your crypto back into cash. High liquidity = easy to sell.
liquidity.analogy: Like having money in your wallet vs buried in your backyard.
liquidity.example: PYUSD has high liquidity - you can sell it anytime.

staking.simple_explanation: Staking is like putting your crypto in a locked savings account. You earn rewards but can't withdraw immediately.
staking.analogy: Like a fixed deposit at the bank - higher interest but locked for a period.
staking.example: Stake 50 PYUSD for 3 months, earn 2 PYUSD bonus.

APY.simple_explanation: APY (Annual Percentage Yield) tells you how much extra money you'll earn in a year.
APY.analogy: Like the interest rate on your savings account, but for crypto.
APY.example: 5% APY means 100 PYUSD becomes 105 PYUSD in one year.

defi.simple_explanation: DeFi (Decentralized Finance) is like a digital bank that works without traditional banks.
defi.analogy: Like having a bank in your phone that works 24/7 without needing permission.
defi.example: Send money, earn interest, get loans - all through your phone.

smart_contract.simple_explanation: A smart contract is like a digital agreement that automatically executes when conditions are met.
smart_contract.analogy: Like a vending machine - put in money, get your item automatically.
smart_contract.example: Send 10 PYUSD, smart contract automatically sends it to the recipient.

gas_fee.simple_explanation: Gas fee is like a small transaction fee you pay to use the blockchain network.
gas_fee.analogy: Like paying for postage when sending a letter.
gas_fee.example: Send 100 PYUSD, pay 0.01 HBAR gas fee.

wallet.simple_explanation: A wallet is like your digital purse that holds your crypto money.
wallet.analogy: Like your physical wallet but for digital money.
wallet.example: Your PKP wallet holds your PYUSD safely.

private_key.simple_explanation: A private key is like the password to your digital wallet. Keep it secret!
private_key.analogy: Like the PIN for your ATM card - never share it.
private_key.example: Your PKP wallet uses advanced security instead of simple passwords.

blockchain.simple_explanation: Blockchain is like a digital ledger that records all transactions permanently.
blockchain.analogy: Like a notebook that everyone can see but no one can erase.
blockchain.example: All PYUSD transactions are recorded on Hedera blockchain.

how_to_start.question: How do I start using DeFi?
how_to_start.answer: Start simple! Send PYUSD to friends, check your balance. Then try yield farming with small amounts.

is_it_safe.question: Is DeFi safe?
is_it_safe.answer: DeFi can be safe if you're careful. Start with trusted protocols and small amounts. Never share your private keys!
safety_tips: Ask 'What is...' before trying new things

how_to_earn.question: How can I earn money with DeFi?
how_to_earn.answer: You can earn by yield farming (lending your PYUSD) or staking (locking crypto for rewards). Start small and learn!
earning_methods: Yield farming: Lend PYUSD, earn interest
Set savings goals for automatic earning
